English:
You managed to get there without incident!
Hee hee! Just as I expected it would go!
Chinese:
看來你順利抵達了。
呵呵，跟我預期的一樣。
Korean:
무사히 도착한 모양이군
후후, 내 예상 대로야
German:
Du hast es ohne Probleme dorthin geschafft!
Hihi! Genau, wie ich erwartet hatte!

English:
Okay, let's move into action. Get the data from
the room in the back while keeping an eye on the
patient.
Chinese:
好，那就開始行動吧！
先確認患者的狀況，然後去內部的控制室取得情報！
Korean:
그럼, 행동을 개시하도록 하지
환자의 모습을 확인하면서, 안쪽에 있는 제어실에서 정보를 입수해 줘
German:
So, legen wir los. Hol dir die Daten
aus dem hinteren Zimmer, aber behalte dabei
den Patienten im Auge.

English:
Leave it to me!
Isn't that a crime?
Chinese:
包在我身上！
這不是犯罪嗎……？
German:
Überlass das nur mir!
Ist das nicht illegal?

English:
That's for the authorities to decide, not us.
If it's against the law, then the law will try us.
Chinese:
決定是不是犯罪的不是我們，而是“法律”。
如果我們有違法的話，終究會受到法律制裁。
Korean:
그걸 정하는 건 우리들이 아닌 "법"이다
위법이라면, 언젠가 법에 의해 심판을 받겠지
German:
Das haben die Behörden zu entscheiden, nicht wir.
Wenn es gegen das Gesetz ist, wird das Gesetz
uns richten.

English: But until then, we're in a bit of a gray area.
Chinese: 但是，在那之前，這裡都還算是“灰色地帶”——
German:
Aber bis dahin sind wir in einer gewissen
Grauzone.

English:
Detectives generally operate unchallenged when it
comes to this sort of thing.
Chinese: 是偵探大顯身手的舞台！
German:
Detektive können in solchen Situationen
normalerweise ziemlich frei handeln.

English: Hmph. I leave it to you, my prospective assistant!
Chinese: 嗯嗯！那就交給你了……“助手候補”！
German:
Hmpf. Ich überlasse es dir, mein angehender
Hilfsdetektiv!
